    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String INTERNAL_HOSTNAME
      Used because in-memory storage of commands requires a hostname for maps when the underlying store does not (host_id is null).

    • Field Detail

      • INTERNAL_HOSTNAME

        public static final String INTERNAL_HOSTNAME
        Used because in-memory storage of commands requires a hostname for maps when the underlying store does not (host_id is null). We also don't want stages getting confused with Ambari vs cluster hosts, so don't use StageUtils.getHostName()
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • addHostRoleExecutionCommand

        public void addHostRoleExecutionCommand(String host,
                                        Role role,
                                        RoleCommand command,
                                        ServiceComponentHostEvent event,
                                        String clusterName,
                                        String serviceName,
                                        boolean retryAllowed,
                                        boolean autoSkipFailure)
        A new host role command is created for execution. Creates both ExecutionCommand and HostRoleCommand objects and adds them to the Stage. This should be called only once for a host-role for a given stage.

      • addHostRoleExecutionCommand

        public void addHostRoleExecutionCommand(Host host,
                                        Role role,
                                        RoleCommand command,
                                        ServiceComponentHostEvent event,
                                        Cluster cluster,
                                        String serviceName,
                                        boolean retryAllowed,
                                        boolean autoSkipFailure)
        A new host role command is created for execution. Creates both ExecutionCommand and HostRoleCommand objects and adds them to the Stage. This should be called only once for a host-role for a given stage.

      • addServerActionCommand

        public void addServerActionCommand(String actionName,
                                   @Nullable
                                   String userName,
                                   Role role,
                                   RoleCommand command,
                                   String clusterName,
                                   ServiceComponentHostServerActionEvent event,
                                   @Nullable
                                   Map<String,String> commandParams,
                                   @Nullable
                                   String commandDetail,
                                   @Nullable
                                   Map<String,Map<String,String>> configTags,
                                   @Nullable
                                   Integer timeout,
                                   boolean retryAllowed,
                                   boolean autoSkipFailure)

        Creates server-side execution command.

        The action name for this command is expected to be the classname of a ServerAction implementation which will be instantiated and invoked as needed.

        Parameters:
        actionName - a String declaring the action name (in the form of a classname) to execute
        userName - the name of the user who created this stage; may be null for anonymous user
        role - the Role for this command
        command - the RoleCommand for this command
        clusterName - a String identifying the cluster on which to to execute this command
        event - a ServiceComponentHostServerActionEvent
        commandParams - a Map of String to String data used to pass to the action - this may be empty or null if no data is relevant
        commandDetail - a String declaring a descriptive name to pass to the action - null or an empty string indicates no value is to be set
        configTags - a Map of configuration tags to set for this command - if null, no configurations will be available for the command
        timeout - an Integer declaring the timeout for this action - if null, a default
        retryAllowed - indicates whether retry after failure is allowed

      • addCancelRequestCommand

                                    String hostName)

      • getHostRoleCommand

        public HostRoleCommand getHostRoleCommand(long taskId)
        Gets the HostRoleCommand matching the specified ID from this stage. This will not hit the database, instead using the pre-cached list of HRCs from the construction of the stage.
        Parameters:
        taskId - the ID to match
        Returns:
        the HostRoleCommand or null if none match.

      • addExecutionCommandWrapper

        public void addExecutionCommandWrapper(Stage origStage,
                                       String hostname,
                                       Role r)
        This method should be used only in stage planner. To add a new execution command use addHostRoleExecutionCommand(String, Role, RoleCommand, ServiceComponentHostEvent, String, String, boolean, boolean)
        Parameters:
        origStage - the stage
        hostname - the hostname; null for a server-side stage
        r - the role

      • getHostRoleCommand

        public HostRoleCommand getHostRoleCommand(String hostname,
                                          String role)
        Parameters:
        hostname - the hostname; null for a server-side stage
        role - the role
        Returns:
        the role command

      • getStageTimeout

        public int getStageTimeout()
        In this method we sum up all timeout values for all commands inside stage

      • isSkippable

        public boolean isSkippable()
        Determine whether or not this stage is skippable. A skippable stage can be skipped on failure so that the remaining stages of the request can execute. If a stage is not skippable, a failure will cause the remaining stages of the request to be aborted.
        Returns:
        true if this stage is skippable

      • setSkippable

        public void setSkippable(boolean skippable)
        Set skippable for this stage. A skippable stage can be skipped on failure so that the remaining stages of the request can execute. If a stage is not skippable, a failure will cause the remaining stages of the request to be aborted.
        Parameters:
        skippable - true if this stage should be skippable

      • isAutoSkipOnFailureSupported

        public boolean isAutoSkipOnFailureSupported()
        Determine whether this stage supports automatically skipping failures of its commands.
        Returns:
        true if this stage supports automatically skipping failures of its commands.

      • setAutoSkipFailureSupported

        public void setAutoSkipFailureSupported(boolean supportsAutoSkipOnFailure)
        Sets whether this stage supports automatically skipping failures of its commands.
        Parameters:
        supportsAutoSkipOnFailure - true if this stage supports automatically skipping failures of its commands.
